verses.roman:
rājā kahe,--"tāre āmi duḥkha nāhi diye
cāṅge caḍā, khaḍge ḍārā,--āmi nā jāniye

synonyms: rājā kahe—the King replied; tāre—to him; āmi—I; duḥkha—unhappiness; nāhi diye—have no desire to give; cāṅge caḍā—the raising on the cāṅga; khaḍge—on the swords; ḍārā—the throwing; āmi—I; nā jāniye—did not know.
translation: The King replied,"I have no desire to give pain to Gopīnātha Paṭṭanāyaka and his family, nor did I know about his being lifted on the cāṅga to be thrown on the swords and killed.
